html: The day of the great “slaughter” or “massacre” (hereg) “when the towers fall” refers to Jehovah’s Day of Judgment but also to a specific day within that time frame of his cleansing of the earth (Isaiah 2:15; 10:3; 34:2). For the righteous, on the other hand, a different day dawns: Jehovah causes waters to break forth in diverse places (Isaiah 35:6-7; 41:18; 44:3-4), increases his people’s light sevenfold (Isaiah 42:16; 58:10; 60:1, 19-20), and heals their fracture and open wound—that is, both their literal ailments and their divisions into scattered branches and peoples (Isaiah 11:13; 58:8; cf. Ezekiel 37:21-22).
